Class ArcXMLImage

java.lang.Object
  org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.ArcXML

public class ArcXMLImage
extends ArcXML

Class that provides static methods to generate ImageServer related ArcXML requests

Author:
jsanz, jcarrasco

getCustomExtentRequest

public static java.lang.String getCustomExtentRequest(java.lang.String srsInput,
                                                      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D envelope,
                                                      java.lang.String srsOutput,
                                                      char ds,
                                                      java.awt.Dimension imageSize,
                                                      java.lang.String format,
                                                      java.lang.String oneLayerId)
Creates a custom ArcXML request to obtain a request projected by the ArcIms server

Parameters:
srsInput - The SRS of the coordinates provided
srsOutput - The SRS of the coordinates needed
envelope - Rectangle2D with the envelope provided
ds - Char with the Decimal Separator
imageSize - Dimension object
oneLayerId - A dumb layer identificator (but valid) of the service
Returns:
String

getInfoRequest

public static java.lang.String getInfoRequest(java.lang.String layerType,
                                              java.lang.String id,
                                              double[] coords,
                                              double[] dists,
                                              java.lang.String coordsys,
                                              char ds)
Creates the ArcXML retrieve INFO of a specific location dependig if the layer is a FEATURECLASS or a IMAGE

Parameters:
layerType - A String with the layer type @see org.gvsig.remoteClient.arcims.utils.ServiceInfoTags
id - The layer id to request
coords - A pair of coordinates with the center of the request
dists - A pair of distances to extend the point to a BoundaryBox
coordsys - A valid EPSG code
Returns:
String with the ArcXML
See Also:
ArcImsProtImageHandler.getElementInfo(ArcImsStatus, int, int, int)
